sn20.1:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn20.1:4.5: “Mendicants, the rafters of a bungalow all lean to the peak and meet at the peak, and when the peak is demolished they’re all demolished too.
sn20.1:4.6: In the same way any unwholesome qualities are rooted in ignorance and meet in ignorance, and when ignorance is demolished they’re all demolished too.
sn20.1:4.7: So you should train like this:
